verses.kjv: Then answered Zophar the Naamathite, and said,
verses.ct: Then Zophar the Naamathite replied:

verses.kjv: Therefore do my thoughts cause me to answer, and for this I make haste.
verses.ct: "My racing thoughts are forcing me to respond — this is why I can't hold back.

verses.kjv: I have heard the check of my reproach, and the spirit of my understanding causeth me to answer.
verses.ct: I've listened to your insulting rebuke, and my understanding compels me to answer.

verses.kjv: Knowest thou not this of old, since man was placed upon earth,
verses.ct: Don't you know this truth from ancient times, ever since humanity was placed on the earth —

verses.kjv: That the triumphing of the wicked is short, and the joy of the hypocrite but for a moment?
verses.ct: that the celebration of the wicked is brief, and the happiness of the godless lasts only a moment?

verses.kjv: Though his excellency mount up to the heavens, and his head reach unto the clouds;
verses.ct: Even if his greatness rises to the heavens and his head reaches the clouds,

verses.kjv: Yet he shall perish for ever like his own dung: they which have seen him shall say, Where is he?
verses.ct: he will still perish forever like his own waste. Those who knew him will ask, 'Where did he go?'

verses.kjv: He shall fly away as a dream, and shall not be found: yea, he shall be chased away as a vision of the night.
verses.ct: He will vanish like a dream and never be found — driven away like a nighttime vision.

verses.kjv: The eye also which saw him shall see him no more; neither shall his place any more behold him.
verses.ct: The eyes that once saw him will never see him again, and his own home will never look on him anymore.

verses.kjv: His children shall seek to please the poor, and his hands shall restore their goods.
verses.ct: His children will have to beg the poor for mercy, and his own hands will give back what he stole.

verses.kjv: His bones are full of the sin of his youth, which shall lie down with him in the dust.
verses.ct: His bones are filled with the sins of his youth, and those sins will lie down with him in the dust.

verses.kjv: Though wickedness be sweet in his mouth, though he hide it under his tongue;
verses.ct: Even though evil tastes sweet in his mouth, and he savors it under his tongue,

verses.kjv: Though he spare it, and forsake it not; but keep it still within his mouth:
verses.ct: even though he holds onto it and won't let it go, keeping it pressed against the roof of his mouth —

verses.kjv: Yet his meat in his bowels is turned, it is the gall of asps within him.
verses.ct: his food will turn sour in his stomach; it becomes cobra venom inside him.

verses.kjv: He hath swallowed down riches, and he shall vomit them up again: God shall cast them out of his belly.
verses.ct: He swallowed down wealth, but he will vomit it back up. God will force it out of his stomach.

verses.kjv: He shall suck the poison of asps: the viper’s tongue shall slay him.
verses.ct: He will drink the poison of cobras; the fangs of a viper will kill him.

verses.kjv: He shall not see the rivers, the floods, the brooks of honey and butter.
verses.ct: He will never enjoy the rivers, the flowing streams of honey and cream.

verses.kjv: That which he laboured for shall he restore, and shall not swallow it down: according to his substance shall the restitution be, and he shall not rejoice therein.
verses.ct: He will have to give back everything he worked for without getting to enjoy it. Whatever profit he gained will be returned, and he will find no pleasure in it.

verses.kjv: Because he hath oppressed and hath forsaken the poor; because he hath violently taken away an house which he builded not;
verses.ct: Because he crushed and abandoned the poor, because he seized houses he never built —

verses.kjv: Surely he shall not feel quietness in his belly, he shall not save of that which he desired.
verses.ct: he will never know contentment inside himself; nothing he craved will be saved.

verses.kjv: There shall none of his meat be left; therefore shall no man look for his goods.
verses.ct: Nothing will be left for him to consume, and so his prosperity will not last.

verses.kjv: In the fulness of his sufficiency he shall be in straits: every hand of the wicked shall come upon him.
verses.ct: At the peak of his abundance, distress will overtake him; the full force of misery will come crashing down on him.

verses.kjv: When he is about to fill his belly, God shall cast the fury of his wrath upon him, and shall rain it upon him while he is eating.
verses.ct: Just as he is filling his stomach, God will unleash burning anger against him, raining it down on him while he eats.

verses.kjv: He shall flee from the iron weapon, and the bow of steel shall strike him through.
verses.ct: He may escape an iron weapon, but a bronze arrow will pierce him through.

verses.kjv: It is drawn, and cometh out of the body; yea, the glittering sword cometh out of his gall: terrors are upon him.
verses.ct: The arrow is pulled out, coming through his back — the gleaming point emerges from his liver. Absolute terror grips him.

verses.kjv: All darkness shall be hid in his secret places: a fire not blown shall consume him; it shall go ill with him that is left in his tabernacle.
verses.ct: Total darkness is stored up for his treasures. A fire no one kindled will devour him, and whatever remains in his tent will be destroyed.

verses.kjv: The heaven shall reveal his iniquity; and the earth shall rise up against him.
verses.ct: The heavens will expose his guilt, and the earth will rise up to testify against him.

verses.kjv: The increase of his house shall depart, and his goods shall flow away in the day of his wrath.
verses.ct: The wealth of his household will be swept away, flowing off like water on the day of God's anger.

verses.kjv: This is the portion of a wicked man from God, and the heritage appointed unto him by God.
verses.ct: This is what God assigns to the wicked — the inheritance that God has decreed for them."
